children.text: The downpipes in this area are spaced at greater than 12m, which will not properly collect the stormwater in accordance with the Building Code of Australia.
Part 3.5.3.5 Downpipes (size and installation) of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA), requires that
‘Downpipes must not serve more than 12m of gutter length for each downpipe’ .

As there is much more than 12m of gutter discharging into this downpipe, an additional downpipe should be fitted into the stormwater system in this area in accordance with the requirements of the BCA.
